name: Running Creek
description:
Introduction

Running creek makes for a lazy afternoon trip being completable in around 3hrs. It also a great canyon to introduce people to abseiling if starting at R2 as the first ~20m is a 45 degree slope on dry rock (easier than Love Creek Falls or Kangaroo point cliffs).

It is also possible to complete the whole canyon in low/medium flow dry above the ankles, making it a great candidate for winter trips.

Approach

Descent

Note: On R4, run the rope underneath the vine at the top of the falls to put you in the optimal line (true left in flow - otherwise the natural line is true right down a very slippery and smooth rockface).

Exit

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media
